chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
s: seq R
x: R
x0: R

Goal:
sorted Rle s -> head x0 s <= x <= last x0 s -> {i : nat | nth x0 s i <= x < nth x0 s (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size s)%nat} + {nth x0 s (size s - 2) <= x <= nth x0 s (size s - 1)}

Premises:
Notation seq := list
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
sorted = fix sorted (T : Type) (Ord : T -> T -> Prop) (s : seq T) {struct s} : Prop := match s with | [::] => True | [:: h0] => True | h0 :: (h1 :: _) as t0 => Ord h0 h1 /\ sorted T Ord t0 end : forall T : Type, (T -> T -> Prop) -> seq T -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
head = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: _ => x end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope nat_scope]
last = fun T : Type => fix last (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : T := match s with | [::] => x | x' :: s' => last x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
Rle = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 < r2 \/ r1 = r2 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
sorted_head : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, head x0 s <= nth x0 s i
sorted_last : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= last x0 s
sorted_incr : forall (s : seq R) (i j : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i <= j)%nat -> (j < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= nth x0 s j
nth_last : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s (Init.Nat.pred (size s)) = last x0 s
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
nth_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (x : T) (n : nat), nth x0 (rcons s x) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) then nth x0 s n else if eqtype.eq_op n (size s) then x else x0)
last_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 x : T) (s : seq T), last x s = nth x0 (x :: s) (size s)
nth_behead : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat), nth x0 (behead s) n = nth x0 s (S n)
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : seq R | head 0 l = a /\ last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < size l)%nat -> nth 0 l i < nth 0 l (S i) <= nth 0 l i + eps)}
nth_cat : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s1 s2 : seq T) (n : nat), nth x0 (s1 ++ s2) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s1) then nth x0 s1 n else nth x0 s2 (ssrnat.subn n (size s1)))
nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth x0 (mkseq f n) i = f i
size_compat : forall s : seq R, Rlength (seq2Rlist s) = size s
sorted_nth : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s0 : seq ?T), sorted Ord s0 < -> (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (size s0))%nat -> forall x1 : ?T, Ord (nth x1 s0 i) (nth x1 s0 (S i))) where ?T : [s : seq R x0 : R x : R |- Type]
cats0 : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T), s ++ [::] = s
size_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), size (rcons s x) = S (size s)
BinIntDef.Z.opp = fun x : Z => match x with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos x0 => Z.neg x0 | Z.neg x0 => Z.pos x0 end : Z -> Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
nth_compat : forall (s : seq R) (n : nat), pos_Rl (seq2Rlist s) n = nth 0 s n
last_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T) (z : T), last x (rcons s z) = z
sumbool_ind : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
nth_iota : forall p m n i : nat, ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth p (seq.iota m n) i = ssrnat.addn m i
last_rev : forall (x1 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), last x1 (rev l) = head x1 l where ?T : [s : seq R x0 : R x : R |- Type]
head_rev : forall (x1 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), head x1 (rev l) = last x1 l where ?T : [s : seq R x0 : R x : R |- Type]
size_rcons_pos : forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), (0 < size (rcons s0 t))%nat where ?T : [s : seq R x0 : R x : R |- Type]
nfloor_ex : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> {n : nat | INR n <= x < INR n + 1}
sorted_cat : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s1 s2 : seq ?T) (x1 : ?T), sorted Ord s1 -> sorted Ord s2 -> Ord (last x1 s1) (head x1 s2) -> sorted Ord (s1 ++ s2) where ?T : [s : seq R x0 : R x : R |- Type]
rev_rev : forall l : seq ?T, rev (rev l) = l where ?T : [s : seq R x0 : R x : R |- Type]
seq2Rlist = fix seq2Rlist (s : seq R) : Rlist := match s with | [::] => nil | h :: t => cons h (seq2Rlist t) end : seq R -> Rlist Argument scope is [seq_scope]
interval_finite_subdiv_between : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal) (Hab : a <= b), let l := proj1_sig (interval_finite_subdiv a b eps Hab) in forall i : nat, (i < size l)%nat -> a <= nth 0 l i <= b
Rinv_le_contravar : forall x y : R, 0 < x -> x <= y -> / y <= / x
rcons = fun T : Type => fix rcons (s : seq T) (z : T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [:: z] | x :: s' => x :: rcons s' z end : forall T : Type, seq T -> T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope _]

```coq
```coq
induction x0; destruct s as [| h t]; simpl.
* rewrite nth0, nth0. apply sorted_head. auto.
* destruct i.
  -- apply sorted_last. auto.
  -- destruct (leb i (size t)) eqn:Hlt.
     ++ apply sorted_incr. auto.
     ++ apply sorted_last. auto.
* destruct (leb i (size t)) eqn:Hlt.
  -- apply sorted_incr. auto.
  -- apply sorted_last. auto.
Qed.
